wikipedia_page.main: Billie Carleton (4 September 1896 – 28 November 1918) was an English musical comedy actress during the First World War.  She began her professional stage career at age 15 and was playing roles in the West End by age 18. She appeared in the hit musical The Boy (1917), which led to a starring role in The Freedom of the Seas in 1918. At the age of 22, she was found dead, apparently of a drug overdose.
